effects.text:
LAN Desktop Terminal

host: client
os: Windows 11
interface: eth0  192.168.10.30/24
gateway:  192.168.10.1

Try: dig web-server

ip addr (simulated)

1: lo0: <LOOPBACK>
    inet 127.0.0.1/8
2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP>
    inet 192.168.10.30/24 brd 192.168.10.255
    default via 192.168.10.1

ifconfig (simulated)

eth0: flags=4163<UP,BROADCAST,RUNNING,MULTICAST>
    inet 192.168.10.30  netmask 255.255.255.0

lo0: flags=73<UP,LOOPBACK,RUNNING>
    inet 127.0.0.1  netmask 255.0.0.0

Routing table (simulated)

Destination        Gateway           Interface
0.0.0.0/0          192.168.10.1      eth0
192.168.10.0/24    link#2            eth0
127.0.0.0/8        link#1            lo0

help: Query DNS records for a name (A record)

effects.text:
; <<>> DiG 9.18.1 <<>> {{name}}
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 12345

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;{{name}}.	IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
{{name}}.	{{TTL}}	IN	A	{{IP}}

;; Query time: {{QUERY_TIME}} msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.10.1#53(192.168.10.1)
;; WHEN: {{TIMESTAMP}}
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 92

help: Query DNS server for name information

effects.text:
PING {{host}} ({{host}}): 56 data bytes
64 bytes from {{host}}: icmp_seq=0 ttl=58 time=12.1 ms
64 bytes from {{host}}: icmp_seq=1 ttl=58 time=12.6 ms

--- {{host}} ping statistics ---
2 packets transmitted, 2 packets received, 0.0% packet loss
round-trip min/avg/max/stddev = 12.1/12.4/12.6/0.2 ms

help: Trace the network path to a destination (simulated)

effects.text:
Connection to {{host}} {{port}} port [tcp/*] succeeded!
# Firewall: PASS (always green in this room)

help: Test TCP connectivity to a host/port (simulated)

effects.text:
Trying {{host}}:{{port}}...
Connected to {{host}}.
Escape character is '^]'.
# Firewall: PASS (always green in this room)

help: Simulate a TLS handshake to <host>:443 (shows ClientHello/ServerHello)

effects.text:
CONNECTED(00000003)
---
ClientHello sent...
ServerHello received...
Certificate chain verified.
---
New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
Verify return code: 0 (ok)

help: Make an HTTP(S) request (http:// triggers HTTP phase, https:// triggers HTTPS phase)

effects.text:
GET {{url}}

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
server: web-server
content-type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

<html>â€¦</html>

# Firewall: PASS (always green in this room)
# Tip: use http:// for plaintext vs https:// for encrypted application data
